result.execSummary:
All charges against Conner A Sprecher in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Conner A Sprecher is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Conner A Sprecher

records.addlTxt: Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
 - Defendant shall not take advance payment for home improvement work.
  - Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today.  
  Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.
  Trial Judge - Br 2

09:59 AM Defendant appeared.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
